Data: Tait to Gibbs, no run and another! But Bucknor doesn't raise his finger. A fierce inswinger as Gibbs goes right back, inside edges it to Gilchrist who tumbles to his left but...Bucknor refuses to raise his finger
Tait to Gibbs, FOUR runs and he crashes this on the front foot but it's just wide of the lone slip - and I reiterate, there's just one slip in there
Tait to Gibbs, FOUR runs fabulous shot. The most textbook of cover drives, creaming it on the front foot through extra cover
Tait to Gibbs, no run ooh well bowled, Tait, cutting this back into Gibbs who is back into his crease - rather late on it - defending off the back foot
Tait to Gibbs, no run shorter this time from Tait, and he grunts in doing so, forcing Gibbs back into his crease and he defends off the back foot

Tait to Gibbs, no run very well bowled from Tait, who has so far been far from the scattergun. In fact, he's been sniper-like: a 93.4mph (150ish kph) inswinger which Gibbs is very late on, nudging it to leg
McGrath to Kemp, 1 run Short and quick from McGrath
McGrath to Gibbs, no run classic McGrath, cutting this back into him and it's defended solidly
McGrath to Gibbs, no run right in the channel there, absolutely perfect line just outside off stump and he comes forward, rather tentatively, defending it back to McGrath
McGrath to Gibbs, no run and McGrath is in once again, chugging up to the crease and again lands it on a sixpenny and Gibbs is forced to block it out on the front foot
McGrath to Gibbs, no run ever so slightly wider from McGrath - the teaser
McGrath to Gibbs, no run Gibbs again leaves it alone outside off
Tait to Kemp, 1 leg bye Another prehistoric grunt from Tait as he flings this down - but it's a little too straight and worked off his pads
Tait to Gibbs, FOUR runs outside off, Gibbs plants his foot and slashes it over the slips - not far off at all
Tait to Gibbs, no run ah, very good comeback from Tait just pitching it up a smidgen more

Tait to Gibbs, 1 run oh hello, a Tait slower ball. That's new - or at least, I've not seen it much before. Gibbs reads it, though, and on the front foot neatly guides it down to third man with surprising deftness
Tait to Kemp, 5 wide oh dear, Tait's replaced his sniper rifle with the greater-spotted potato gun. This is miles down the leg side and Gilchrist doesn't have a chance
Tait to Kemp, no run on off stump this time, much better, and it's firmly defended
Tait to Kemp, no run cracking ball, at high pace, swinging into the right hander who digs it out at the very last moment. A yorker, in fact
Bracken to Gibbs, 1 run and he starts lazily, drifting it down the leg side and Gibbs plucks it with ease to leg
Bracken to Kemp, 1 run ooh close! A lovely delivery angling across a very nervous Justin Kemp who, even more nervously, pushes forward without conviction and edges it past the second slip
Bracken to Gibbs, no run defended on the front foot
Bracken to Gibbs, 1 run ah, delightful shot, coming forward on the front foot and just working it - smudging it - through midwicket
Bracken to Kemp, no run gets into a bit of a tangle, Kemp, here. A shorter delivery which rises up on him and he defends, using his chest
Watson to Gibbs, FOUR runs what a magnificent shot from Gibbs, a flick behind square which beats the man at deep square leg
Watson to Gibbs, no run and Gibbs drives with vast amounts of class here, but straight to cover
Watson to Gibbs, no run much better from Watson - that's the length and it's pumped back to the bowler
Watson to Gibbs, no run just a little wider this time from Watson and Gibbs is back-and-across, pushing it out to cover
Watson to Gibbs, 1 run a Watson slower-ball which is nicely nudged off the front foot down to fine leg
Watson to Kemp, no run Kemp is less deft, but he defends with a solid lunge of the front foot and pushes this back to the bowler
Hogg to Gibbs, no run quick, on middle-and-leg and it's worked further to leg
Hogg to Gibbs, 1 run again on leg stump - quick and flat - turned around the corner
Hogg to Kemp, no run well bowled, on middle stump and Kemp comes forward - massively - defending it on the front foot
Hogg to Kemp, no run that's more like it from Kemp, hammering it on the front foot and timing it very well but straight to cover
Hogg to Kemp, no run what a ball from the tongue-master, a wrong'un which Kemp complete misreads, coming forward, trying to defend, but missing it by a country mile
Hogg to Kemp, no run and again he's beaten
Watson to Gibbs, FOUR runs poor delivery, short and straight, Gibbs pulling it behind square
Watson to Gibbs, no run better
Watson to Gibbs, no run good idea from Watson, who increasingly resembles the incredible hulk, bouncing the batsman...but he's pretty settled now, ducking underneath it easily
Watson to Gibbs, no run pushed back to the bowler and Gibbs gives him a stare. And why not?
Watson to Gibbs, 1 run calmly strokes past short extra cover
Watson to Kemp, 1 run on middle-and-off, Kemp lunges forward like a monster and defends
Hogg to Kemp, 2 runs poor ball outside leg, deftly paddled around the corner
Hogg to Kemp, 1 run very well played again, straighter this time and he plants his foot down the pitch and ladles it around the corner
Hogg to Gibbs, 1 run flicked through midwicket
Hogg to Kemp, no run blocked out on the front foot
Hogg to Kemp, 1 run a full bunger from Hogg, punched through cover - rather takes Kemp by surprise, hence not trying to hit it into the USA
Watson to Kemp, no run defended on the front foot
Watson to Kemp, no run excellent ball on off stump and he comes forward to defend this out to cover
Watson to Kemp, no run ah, now then - that's more like it from Watson. An excellent bouncer which takes the batsman by surprise, as he attempts to pull before deciding to leave it well alone
Watson to Kemp, 2 runs Kemp late-cuts this with oodles of time, and class, behind point and wide of third man who sprints to his right to field
Watson to Kemp, no run swinging into him, it's defended on the front foot
Watson to Kemp, no run another good one just outside off. Watson bowling with excellent control so far and it's blocked out
Hogg to Gibbs, 1 run on leg stump, picked off for a single
Hogg to Kemp, no run ooh, this one holds up on him - just outside off, spinning back into him and jumping up a touch, it's blocked out
Hogg to Kemp, no run full and straight, blocked out
Hogg to Kemp, no run and he plays and misses outside off - the arm ball there
Hogg to Kemp, 1 run on leg stump - flatter and quicker and defended
Hogg to Gibbs, no run beaten! Terrific ball, the wrong'un which he plays at and misses, Hogg's tongue slavers around uncontrollably
Watson to Kemp, no run on leg and that's skewed in front of square to the man there
Watson to Kemp, no run slower ball, on the money, and that's defended forward
Watson to Kemp, no run beautiful delivery that one, nipping back in at the righthander and threatening to kiss the outside edge
Watson to Kemp, no run left alone this time

Watson to Kemp, SIX runs short and Kemp's on that one so quickly, fending the ball with a hook right off his helmet - top work, that was close to him, and although he didn't get hold of it properlyit sailed away. And that's the fifty partnership
Watson to Kemp, no run defended off the back foot into the covers
Hogg to Gibbs, 1 run on leg, the batsman comes forward and sweeps that round on the front foot behind square
Hogg to Kemp, 1 run swept that round behind square
Hogg to Gibbs, no run the one that went the other way - the ball, not his tongue - and that slavers outside off and is left alone easily
Hogg to Gibbs, 1 run another ball on leg, another sweep, this one dinked as gentle as the others
Hogg to Kemp, 1 run on middle, doesn't read that one, and a tentative prod from Kemp sends an outside edge backward of point
Hogg to Gibbs, 1 wide outside leg, chased round, and that's just to say wide
Hogg to Gibbs, 1 run on leg and that turns towards leg even more, the batsman just poking that into short square
Tait to Gibbs, no run bouncer, straight and high. Tait follows through with a serious look on his face - he means more business here all right

Tait to Gibbs, FOUR runs outside off, way too much width and Gibbs just opens his shoulders and swings hard, and that one flies up off the base of the bat behind point, not quite where he intended it, but it fair raced away
Tait to Gibbs, no run pushes him back up there to defend into the covers

Tait to Gibbs, OUT got him this time! A very, very thin edge - much thinner than the one which wasn't given earlier, also to Tait - looking for the short-pitched delivery. His feet were just rooted in the crease there as he chased the ball away from his body
Tait to Hall, no run good pace, right up there and scattering a cloud of dust as Hall edges that low, on the front foot, and unconvincingly down towards the slip region
Hogg to Kemp, no run up there again, on middle, and that's defended once more, on the front foot again
Hogg to Kemp, no run pitches on middle, moves to off and Kemp's not sure how to play that - he tries to sweep, doesn't really get hold of the ball
Hogg to Kemp, no run defended again, Kemp not looking at all comfortable
Hogg to Kemp, 1 wide wide down off, Kemp backs away to give himself room to cut, but that one went the other way and he was miles away from it
Hogg to Kemp, 1 wide another wide down off. By George! Hogg can't believe that one - not sure why, it was very wide
Hogg to Kemp, no run defended this time
Hogg to Kemp, no run comes forward and defends that one on the front foot. Not much fuss about that shot
Tait to Kemp, no run outside off and that's swished at off the back foot. Little foot movement, his turn to borrow the team glue
Tait to Kemp, no run left alone outside off this time
Tait to Kemp, FOUR runs on leg and that's tucked tidily round off the hips, very fine, through fine leg. Awful ball, got the treatment
Tait to Kemp, no run defended on the front foot
Tait to Kemp, 1 wide down leg and that's accurately called wide
Tait to Kemp, no run slightly slower ball, up there, and that's defended down
Hogg to Pollock, no run on off and Pollock gets his body over that one, defending it forward
Hogg to Pollock, FOUR runs touch of room and Pollock waits for that, and cuts it away off the back foot through cover. Lovely shot, bringing up the hundred en route too, note you
Hogg to Pollock, no run on off and that's defended down off the back foot
Hogg to Pollock, OUT awkward shot, checking his off-drive and that's chipped back to the bowler whose clasping fingers accept that fly-trap-style
Hogg to Nel, no run ooh, Nel pops up a catch into the vacant short-leg area. He's such a tease
Hogg to Nel, no run Hogg gets his revenge, Nel's got no idea what to do that with that and settles for poking a bat at it and it fizzes past his edge. Nel smiles, his tongue popping out, too
McGrath to Kemp, 1 run a touch of width, very unMcGrathian, and that's worked away to the off-side sweeper
McGrath to Nel, no run poor Nel's a bit at sea here and there's more poking and missing
McGrath to Nel, no run left alone outside off
McGrath to Nel, no run

McGrath to Nel, no run outside off, short, and Nel gamely has a slash at that one off the back foot, looking to send it to Row Z over covers. It doesn't even make blade of grass A off the wicket, as he misses it completely
McGrath to Nel, 2 runs sent high over midwicket, it lands safe and McGrath's hands fly to his hip as if there should be fielders everywhere
Hogg to Kemp, no run stroked tamely, like patting a dog, off the back foot into the leg0side off the back foot
Hogg to Kemp, 1 leg bye on leg and that's tucked without much power off the thighs and into square leg
Hogg to Nel, no run more defence - Nel has no idea what's Gwyn on out there (OK, sorry)
Hogg to Nel, no run outside off and that's swished at on the front knee, horrid shot, almost playing that beside himself
Hogg to Nel, no run defends on the front foot
Hogg to Nel, no run more defence and Nel's relieved that over's over
McGrath to Kemp, no run defended on the front foot
McGrath to Kemp, no run slower ball slinked through on a good length, outside off, and Kemp lashes at it, but under it away from his body
McGrath to Kemp, no run cuts in on a good length, and just outside off, and the batsman clamps down on that, desperately keeping the ball out
McGrath to Kemp, no run slower ball and that one just, just leaps over middle stick and there's another fresh-air swipe
McGrath to Kemp, 1 run a hint of room which is enough to be guided behind point and leave Nel exposed
McGrath to Nel, no run right up there and, like a great exclusive, that's well dug out
Hogg to Kemp, no run defended this time
Hogg to Kemp, 1 run swept round behind square and out towards the boundary where the sweeper fulfils his job description
Hogg to Nel, no run a heave
Hogg to Nel, no run more defence
Hogg to Nel, no run on the front foot and just kills the threat with a dead bat
Hogg to Nel, no run defended forward
Watson to Kemp, no run up there and that's defended into the covers
Watson to Kemp, FOUR runs outside off, just a touch of width and that's a very good shot indeed, that one cut away off the back foot with a mere flick of the wrists
Watson to Kemp, 1 run width again, but only a mere hint
Watson to Nel, FOUR runs on off, a touch short, and that's pulled round with a delightful pirouette behind square
Watson to Nel, 1 run nibbles in at the righthander, poked into the covers and they run a quick single
Watson to Kemp, no run opens the face but can only run that one to gully
Hogg to Nel, no run right up there, awkward to deal with, and Nel pokes that one down
Hogg to Nel, no run comes forward, a deliberate yet clunky stride, and that's defended into the covers
Hogg to Nel, no run outside off and that's cut down - the ball just died a touch on him, this pitch is pretty slow
Hogg to Nel, no run oh, attempted flipper, and that's a big call from the Aussies, a better one from the umpires
Hogg to Nel, no run defended forward
Hogg to Nel, no run outside off, veering down, and that's tucked to point off the back foot
Tait to Kemp, no run on a length outside off and that nips back in, defended down
Tait to Kemp, 1 wide Tait flies into bowl, that lovely rhythm ending in a muscly delivery as ever - but all that effort goes to waste as this one is wide down off
Tait to Kemp, 1 run changed his angle of approach ever so slightly, that's right up there on the money but poked forward for a quick single
Tait to Nel, no run too quick for Nel who, like a spotty boy in a disco, aims a desperate - and futile - lunge at that one
Tait to Nel, 1 wide wide down off
Tait to Nel, no run outside off and that's poked into the ground at the last minute - Nel again not really dealing with the pace
Tait to Nel, no run outside off and that's driven off the back foot in front of point
Tait to Nel, no run up there, the usual grunt, on off, and that's defended into the covers
Watson to Kemp, no run defended on the back foot
Watson to Kemp, 1 run poked forward and there's a quick single
Watson to Nel, no run a quick would-be single into the midwicket region and Nel and Kemp both set off, then have to dive to make their ground. Nel finds the whole thing hilarious
Watson to Nel, no run dinked into the leg side
Watson to Nel, no run lowish full toss - thigh height - and Nel deals well with the approaching weapon, defending that down without much fuss
Watson to Nel, no run in the blockhole, but Nel doesn't block, rather he drives back to the bowler on the bounce, who snaps at it, gets his right hand on it and parries the ball into the ground
Tait to Kemp, 1 run on leg and that's driven out to McGrath at mid-on
Tait to Nel, no run up there again, a yorker on off stick, and that's bumped into the ground
Tait to Nel, no run on leg, slower delivery, and that's prodded into mid-on
Tait to Nel, no run attempted bouncer, doesn't lift as much as he would expected, chest height nonetheless and that kicks through down the channel
Tait to Nel, no run swing there, and that's dug out into the covers
Tait to Nel, no run driven forward and that rounds off another stifling over
Watson to Kemp, 1 run up there and driven forward, straight, without much power
Watson to Nel, 1 leg bye speared in on leg, dinked into short cover, and there's a shy and a miss at the non-striker's end
Watson to Kemp, 1 run low full toss, driven out to straight midwicket where Ponting does well to dive and take the pace off the ball with a left-hand grasp. It's tidied up further out
Watson to Nel, 1 leg bye on leg, Nel tries to get bat on it, the umpire rules pad, and they shuffle a quick single
Watson to Kemp, 1 run driven forward and there's another single
Watson to Nel, 1 run bouncer, and another single up ... and down to third man
Tait to Hall, no run awkward bounce to deal with that one, but Hall stays cool as ever defending down off the back foot
Tait to Hall, 1 run gets his yorker line all wrong, and that's worked off the toes out to Mr Hussey-Cricket on the deep square boundary and he does a slide and relay with McGrath
Tait to Kemp, no run left alone outside off this time
Tait to Kemp, no run better yorker this time, obviously the length was right as before, but this time it was on the toes and that's just defended forward
Tait to Kemp, no run bouncer down the channel and Kemp leaves that one alone
Tait to Kemp, no run another bouncer, straight, and that's well avoided
Hogg to Hall, no run tosses that one up, it dips naughtily at the last minute and the batsman rolls out a tame forward drive
Hogg to Hall, 1 run swished off the toes to short midwicket
Hogg to Kemp, no run right up there and there's a play and a miss
Hogg to Kemp, 1 run some room outside off, the batsman waits and cuts that away into the covers with a mere tuck of a cut
Hogg to Hall, 1 run turning away towards off again, this shot isn't so neat, an ugly chop down, yet again into the covers
Tait to Nel, OUT short and wide, slashed high to backward point who backpeddled and took an easy catch above his head
Tait to Kemp, no run slower ball - if you can describe 81mph as slower - and Langeveldt into line to block
Tait to Kemp, no run faster and a bit shorter, Langeveldt sways out of the way. It probably would have missed him anyway
Tait to Kemp, no run full, Langeveldt winds up and drives the ball to Hogg at mid-off
Tait to Kemp, 1 wide Tait loses his bearings and spears one down the leg side
Tait to Kemp, no run full and this time on target, Kemp defends
Tait to Kemp, 1 run quite deliberately and safely steered down to third man. Kemp keeps the strike
Watson to Kemp, FOUR runs Watson attempts the yorker, doesn't quite get it right and Kemp slams a full toss back over the bowler's head
Watson to Kemp, 1 run full, driven almost as hard but there is a long-off in place
Watson to Langeveldt, no run Langeveldt heads towards the square-leg umpire and blocks
Watson to Langeveldt, 1 run decent ball which Langeveldt swings at, hits, and the ball arcs short of the man out in the deep on the off side
Watson to Kemp, FOUR runs another full toss from Watson which Kemp absolutely smears through extra cover
Watson to Kemp, no run slower ball but Kemp can't find the single he needs, leaving Langeveldt exposed

Tait to Hall, OUT and Tait strikes again! Hall looked to lash that off the back foot through cover, but his feet must have been dipped in the same tub of superglue as Gibbs's as he strikes at the ball away from the body and a thickish edge rips through. Gilchrist makes no mistake

Tait to Pollock, no run oh, Pollock was lucky to survive there, this one nipping back in off the seam and Pollock doing his valiant best to give Gilchrist another catching opportunity - but failed to get hold of it

Tait to Pollock, no run right up there and that's poked into the covers. A bit of shuffling from Hogg in his sunhat as he takes his time to throw down the stumps. It looked in, and replays quickly confirmed it was
Tait to Pollock, 1 run bouncer crashes into Pollock's gloves at just-crouching height - Pollock did well to shield his body there, but he's not looking comfortable
Tait to Kemp, no run plays that away from his body, poking it down to gully off the back foot
Tait to Kemp, no run more grunting from Tait, and that's up there, defended just outside off and just in front of yorker length
Bracken to Pollock, no run he's over the wicket and that's defended forward first up
Bracken to Pollock, no run across the righthander again and that's defended into the covers
Bracken to Pollock, no run on middle and off, Pollock plays that into the covers in a very defensive manner
Bracken to Pollock, no run straight, a touch short, and defended easily enough on the back foot this time
Bracken to Pollock, no run outside off, Pollock tries to cut that off the back foot through point, but chops an inside edge down into the ground, safely enough
Bracken to Langeveldt, 1 run Langeveldt drops into the leg side and runs. McGrath teapots that the No. 11 was allowed to get off strike first ball
Bracken to Kemp, 1 run Kemp sweeps, Bracken appeals thinking it missed the bat, but Bucknor disagrees
Bracken to Langeveldt, no run driven into the covers
Bracken to Langeveldt, no run punched square on the off side
Bracken to Langeveldt, no run Langeveldt misses with a swish to leg, strangled appeal as it again pitched outside the line
Bracken to Langeveldt, no run defended into the off side, a quiet over but at least Kemp keeps the strike
Watson to Kemp, no run Kemp heaves over midwicket to Hayden in the deep, but they decide not to run
Watson to Kemp, 1 run driven straight to Tait at long-on, it went high but right to him. he caught it , dropped it, juggled the rebound before ending up in a big heap with the ball next to him
Watson to Langeveldt, no run a big heave and a big miss
Watson to Langeveldt, FOUR runs another heave from Langeveldt who is heading towards square leg as he plays it, over point and over the rope
Watson to Langeveldt, OUT up in the block hole and Langeveldt, again giving himself room, is in no position to play it and is cleaned up

That's South Africa's lowest score in the World Cup and Australia bounce off the field. On TV they are still pretending this game is well and truly alive, but the reality is that it will take something remarkable to prevent Australia reaching the final now.

Lubna Kabir reckons you don't need a bar for some places in the States - instead, Indian restaurants frequented by Indian, Sri Lankan, Bangladeshi and Pakistani taxi drivers should do it - in Boston, DC and Philly for sure.
A quick note - these suggestions are from readers and we in no way endorse them or vouch for the accuracy of the information.

1.00pm Various readers have answered questions as to where the final will be shown in the USA. NY/NJ -Cafe Spice in Jersey City has been showing all World Cup matches, and Galaxy Cinema, Raleigh, NC is showing all the games, and Eight Mile Creek, an Aussie bar/restaurant on Mulberry St ... and also Ship of Fools on 2nd Ave at 82nd ... Boston - Tommy Doyle's in Harvard Square,
1.25pm That's the public service broadcast over. Hope it helps. We are still not aware of anywhere in Miami and there have been loads of requests from there, so shout if you can help.

Welcome back all. It is I, Will, here for another 10 over stint - which ought to be just enough time for Australia to knock off these 150 runs. Well nearly, anyway. I'm just finishing off my Ploughmans (cheddar, for the cheese freaks among you) and we're about five minutes away from starting. Damn smoking police. Anyway, hope our pub crawl information proved useful. If you do
For those in Florida Churchill's Pub off 2nd Ave in Miami will show the World Cup...or at least it ought to, suggests Frank, who watched the Ashes from there.
Sad news has just come in from Cricinfo's obituary expert, Martin, who tells us Arthur Milton has died.
Pollock to open (the bowling. Obviously. He hasn't defected to Australia). Blustery out there which could help him. Let's face it; South Africa need all the assistance they can get
Pollock to Gilchrist, no run on off stump, a good length and it's defended
Pollock to Gilchrist, no run a well-timed defensive push back to the bowler
Pollock to Gilchrist, 1 run Pollocks drifts this one down the leg side and Gilchrist nobbles it off his pads for a bye
Pollock to Hayden, no run short and wide, Hayden's eyes light up and he cracks it straight to short extra cover
Pollock to Hayden, no run Pollock roars for no apparent reason, probably just felt like it, and Hayden defends this off the back foot
Langeveldt to Ponting, 1 wide well he got a bit too excited there, Langeveldt. Short, wobbling down Ponting's leg side who attempted to pull before realising there was no need
Langeveldt to Ponting, no run and that'll be another wide this time outside the off stump. But no, Aleem Dar thinks about it but decides it's just within the limitations
Langeveldt to Ponting, no run again very wide and much too short from Langeveldt, allowing Ponting to crack it off the back foot into the covers
Langeveldt to Ponting, no run ah, there's the length
Langeveldt to Ponting, no run a touch too short again but the line was straight, forcing Ponting to defend which he did with the straightest of bats
Langeveldt to Ponting, FOUR runs my word, that is a thing of majesty from Ponting. On his middle-and-leg stump, he walks into the most perfectly timed on-drive
Pollock to Hayden, no run Hayden is forward, taking a giant stride down the pitch, working it powerfully to mid-off
Pollock to Hayden, no run far too wide from Pollock who is very fortunate not to be clattered for at least four
Pollock to Hayden, no run swinging into Hayden, a much better length this time and it's pushed to a short extra cover
Pollock to Hayden, no run just short of a length, Hayden cuts it to cover but again can't break the gap
Pollock to Hayden, no run well bowled. Angling across Hayden who immediately decides to leave it alone, shouldering arms. Six of those please, Pollock
Pollock to Hayden, no run and he finishes the over well, dead-eye straight and Hayden works it to leg but can't get a single

Langeveldt to Ponting, FOUR runs and he's dropped. Ponting pulls, with immense power, and Prince at short midwicket dives to his right to attempt to pull off one of the tournament's most brilliant catches...but can only get a fingertip to it. Such was the force if Ponting's stroke that it still went for four
Langeveldt to Ponting, (no ball) cracked off the back foot to cover
Langeveldt to Ponting, no run good line, here, Ponting pushing it off the back foot
Langeveldt to Ponting, FOUR runs shot, Ponting, pulling this shorter delivery quite beautifully through midwicket - in front of square, too
Langeveldt to Ponting, no run ah, good comeback from Langeveldt, the former prison officer, forcing Ponting to defend on the front foot. That's the length
Langeveldt to Ponting, FOUR runs exquisitely driven straight back past the bowler for four. No more need be said
Pollock to Hayden, no run cut to point

Pollock to Hayden, 3 runs oh but he's off the mark now. Hayden's had enough of this block-prod-block malarkey, picking up this half volley and dispatching it over midwicket for four. Not pretty, but very Hayden-esque
Pollock to Ponting, 1 run that's a terrific line from Pollock, on off stump and Ponting pushes it just past the bowler - immediately Ponting sets off for a run, and gets it, much to Pollock's disgust
Pollock to Hayden, no run a squirted, smudged yet purposeful inside edge to mid-on
Pollock to Hayden, no run good length just outside off and Hayden is resolute in defence
Pollock to Hayden, FOUR runs oh he's definitely had enough now, Hayden. A stroke of brute, ugly power, heaving it through midwicket, flat, for four
Kallis to Ponting, no run a touch too wide but a good length, Ponting defends off the back foot back to Kallis
Kallis to Ponting, no run too straight from Kallis, on Ponting's middle stump and he flicks his wrists to midwicket, setting off for a single before Hayden sends him back
Kallis to Ponting, no run another big stride down the pitch from Ponting, creaming it to cover. He looks in absurd touch
Kallis to Ponting, no run good length, just drawing Ponting forward - at good pace, too - and Ponting cracks it on the front foot, opening the face of the bat, to Gibbs at point
Kallis to Ponting, no run driven to extra cover
Kallis to Ponting, no run a textbook cover drive, but straight to mid-off
Nel to Hayden, no run and it's defended off the back foot
Nel to Hayden, 1 run banged in short, but it's down the leg side and Hayden works it down to fine-leg. Nel falls over in his follow-through, as he so often does

Nel to Ponting, FOUR runs terrible ball, a massive wide which Ponting just leans into, stroking it through cover, bisecting mid-off and cover, and it races for four. Absolutely no chance of stopping that
Nel to Ponting, 1 run ooh that's better from Nel, a tighter line which forces Ponting to defend...though it's padded away and they pick up a single
Nel to Hayden, 1 run but it's too straight, Nel not able to adjust his line and Hayden clips a single to leg
Nel to Ponting, no run driven to mid-off
Kallis to Hayden, 1 wide good bounce from Kallis but, oh dear, it's very wide of the off stump and rightly wided by the not-so-wide umpire
Kallis to Hayden, no run ooh and a play-and-a-miss outside off - fuller this time from Kallis and Hayden tries to late cut, but the ball kept a touch low
Kallis to Hayden, no run crunched on the front foot to cover
Kallis to Hayden, no run hammered! My word, he very nearly killed short extra cover. Andrew Hall the fielder there
Kallis to Hayden, FOUR runs grief, that is some shot from Hayden. No great foot movement, flicked on the up through mid-on for four. Extraordinary shot in fact
Kallis to Hayden, 1 run pushed to mid-off this time and he sets off for a single
Kallis to Ponting, no run worked to leg but no single on offer
Nel to Hayden, no run defended on the front foot
Nel to Hayden, no run just a touch wide, giving Hayden the room to free his arms and he strokes it to cover but Hall does magnificently to prevent the single. Or the two, three or indeed four
Nel to Hayden, no run tighter line and a fuller length which Hayden back-cuts to point

Nel to Hayden, 3 runs on leg stump, Hayden leans on it and clips it through midwicket. But the man at deep midwicket makes a fumble, allowing them through for two. Hall is not pleased, and the stump mic picks up every word
Nel to Ponting, 1 wide wide of the off stump, left alone...but it's a wide
Nel to Ponting, no run down on one knee, Ponting carves it to cover
Kallis to Hayden, 1 run swinging into Hayden who works it through midwicket
Kallis to Clarke, 1 leg bye drifting down Clarke's leg side and he works it off his pads
Kallis to Hayden, FOUR runs absolutely magnificent shot. The power...just breathless. Perfectly reasonable ball
Kallis to Hayden, no run again monstrously struck but this time straight to mid-off
Kallis to Hayden, no run timed off the back foot to extra cover
Kallis to Hayden, no run Hayden pulls but, for once, can't get hold of it
Nel to Clarke, no run shuffled through, bustling effort, but that's just left alone outside off - Clarke with all the time in the world (cue Louis Armstrong song music)
Nel to Clarke, no run more leaving
Nel to Clarke, no run a bit of wobble and no dobble as that one nips back in and that's defended forward
Nel to Clarke, no run more leaving this time, that one outside off
Nel to Clarke, FOUR runs nice shot to get off the mark, leaning into that one outside off on the front foot and Nel's furious with himself
Nel to Clarke, no run outside off and that's just defended forward
Kallis to Hayden, 2 runs over the wicket, by the way, that's poked into the covers for a quick single and there's a very close shy from ABCdEV... ooh. Overthrows result
Kallis to Hayden, 1 run dabbed out off the back foot out to deep point where it's winged back in without much fuss
Kallis to Clarke, no run left alone outside off
Kallis to Clarke, no run hostile bouncer, Kallis finding some spring there with one which whistles past the grille. Good bouncing, there
Kallis to Clarke, no run a tamer one, this just floating down the channel and it's left alone easily
Nel to Hayden, 1 run driven straight to long-off
Nel to Clarke, no run outside off and Clarke launches into a cover-drive but he doesn't time it very well at all
Nel to Clarke, no run left alone outside off
Nel to Clarke, no run bustled through down the channel and Clarke leaves it alone again
Nel to Clarke, 1 run outside off and Clarke drives that, again without total timing, to the covers
Nel to Hayden, no run round the wicket and that's eased into the covers
Kallis to Clarke, 1 run just to say strays onto leg and that's tucked into square
Kallis to Hayden, 4 leg byes outside leg, that would have been good to a righthander, but he's a lefty, of course, and that's pawed round through fine leg
Kallis to Hayden, no run a touch of width outside off, Hayden connects cleanly and cuts that to gully
Kallis to Hayden, 1 run quick single to mid-off
Kallis to Clarke, 1 run on leg and that's tucked forward with some excellent placement in front of midwicket - Hayden turned down the second

Kallis to Hayden, (no ball) 1 run on off and Hayden fails to pull that cleanly in front of square - ah, an overstepped no-ball is signalled - and he rehearses the shot when he makes it to the non-striker's end
Kallis to Clarke, 1 run on leg, bounces up and that's tucked into short midwicket
Nel to Clarke, no run left alone outside off
Nel to Clarke, no run a touch of width outside off and that's cut to point
Nel to Clarke, no run outside off, short, and Nel's really pleased with himself, jogging through and laughing like Muttley. Clarke goes to play and then drops his hands at the last minute
Nel to Clarke, no run outside off again, driven to the covers and again it's all about waiting on
Nel to Clarke, no run on off and that's driven to the covers
Nel to Clarke, no run more of the off-side stuff, tidy, and that's defended down
Langeveldt to Hayden, 1 run up there, on off, and that's driven back out to mid-on
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run outside off, dragged down a touch, and that's poked off the back foot to the covers
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run outside off and Clarke shuffles over with his pleasingly straight bat which he presents to the ball
Langeveldt to Clarke, 1 run outside off and that's driven out to extra cover
Langeveldt to Hayden, no run on off and that's driven to short cover where it's picked up immediately
Langeveldt to Hayden, no run over the wicket, incidentally, and that's driven into the covers
Hall to Clarke, 2 runs on leg and that's tucked in front of square
Hall to Clarke, no run on the money and that's driven to covers
Hall to Clarke, FOUR runs on leg and that's a lovely shot from Clarke, timing that off his legs in front of midwicket
Hall to Clarke, 1 run outside off, eased through the covers
Hall to Hayden, 1 run driven forward and there's a nice little single
Hall to Clarke, no run on leg and that's poked to short midwicket
Langeveldt to Hayden, no run comes from wide of the wicket, and round too, and that's defended forward
Langeveldt to Hayden, no run on the money, on off, and that's defended forward
Langeveldt to Hayden, 1 run right up there and that's driven straight
Langeveldt to Clarke, 1 run outside and that's thlocked out to the cover boundary with a caress of a nudge off the front foot
Langeveldt to Hayden, FOUR runs slower ball monstered through long-off with a two-bounce four - doesn't even hang around to see where the ball went. Nonchalant or what
Langeveldt to Hayden, no run straight batted off the back foot to mid-off
Hall to Clarke, no run up there and that's defended forward
Hall to Clarke, no run straight and played forward
Hall to Clarke, no run right up there and that's driven to mid-off
Hall to Clarke, 2 runs driven through the covers and that's two more rubbed off the target
Hall to Clarke, no run driven into the circle on the leg-side and that's thrown back in
Hall to Clarke, FOUR runs outside off and that's driven through cover
Langeveldt to Hayden, 1 run driven to wide mid-on
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run driven to mid-off
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run outside off and driven to cover
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run outside off, down on one knee and that's driven to cover
Langeveldt to Clarke, FOUR runs slower ball, lovely shot, a languid punch through mid-off
Langeveldt to Clarke, 1 run tucked off the hips to square
Hall to Clarke, no run straight and blocked, all very correct

Hall to Clarke, 1 run driven to mid-on and a quick single, Pollock picks up and hurls the ball right into the ground in front of Boucher, the kind of return that you see regularly in club cricket (well, at Merrow you do)
Hall to Hayden, no run hit back hard at Hall, on the half volley and he semi stops before ringing his hand in pain
Hall to Hayden, no run blocked to mid-on about twice as hard as most people can drive it, Pollock stops
Hall to Hayden, 2 runs yorker which Hayden jams down on, still managing to squeeze the ball into the leg side
Hall to Hayden, no run knee-high full toss, hit back to Hall who stick out his right hand and fields
Kemp to Clarke, no run very gentle loosener, pushed into the off side
Kemp to Clarke, 1 run drifts to leg and Clarke helps it on its way to long leg
Kemp to Hayden, no run prodded to mid-off
Kemp to Hayden, no run patted to extra cover
Kemp to Hayden, no run defended into the off
Kemp to Hayden, no run full toss hammered straight at mid-on. You can almost hear the purring in the commercial department at ICC Towers in Dubai
Pollock to Clarke, 1 run half volley push-driven to long-on
Pollock to Hayden, 1 run to describe this as pedestrian is an insult to pedestrians ... patted to long-off for variety
Pollock to Clarke, no run steered off the open face of the bat to point
Pollock to Clarke, 1 run driven to long-on
Pollock to Hayden, no run slightly shorter, Hayden drops at his feet and looks for a quick single, Clarke decides that would be too exciting and turns it down
Pollock to Hayden, 2 runs clipped to deep midwicket where Nel is lurking, both batsmen push for two from the off and make it with ease
Kemp to Clarke, 2 runs leg-side half volley, clipped off his toes and Pollock has to chug round from long leg to field
Kemp to Clarke, no run well bowled ... a yorker which Clarke dug out late
Kemp to Clarke, no run mistimed drive, aimed at mid-off and hit to mid-on
Kemp to Clarke, no run flicked to mid-on
Kemp to Clarke, no run firm drive back to Kemp, the ball bounces kindly to him at midriff height
Kemp to Clarke, 1 run leggish and Clarke sweetly whips that wide of midwicket and mid-on has to scoot round to field
Pollock to Clarke, no run slightly short, cut hard to point
Pollock to Clarke, no run outside off, Clarke looks to cut again, misses and Boucher whips the bails off
Pollock to Clarke, 1 run third time lucky, outside off and this time Clarke finds the space, running the ball down to third man
Pollock to Clarke, 1 run Clarke stands tall and smacks the ball off the back foot through extra cover
Pollock to Symonds, no run firm drive but no run as he fails to find the gap either side of mid-off
Hall to Clarke, no run half volley driven to Smith at mid-on. Smith grimaces as he bends and switches to mid-off hoping the ball doesn't go there
Hall to Clarke, no run back to the bowler, much to Smith's relief
Hall to Clarke, 1 run driven straight back to the right of Hall, mid-on scampers round to field. had Smith been there, he would never have made it
Hall to Symonds, 1 run Symonds back again, this time he flicks it square on the leg to get off the mark
Hall to Clarke, FOUR runs Jenny purrs as Clarke eases the ball off his pads between mid-on and midwicket. All so easy, all so predictable
Nel to Symonds, FOUR runs horrible long-hop which may have been an attempted bouncer from the snarling Nel, Symonds smacks it dismissively through midwicket. Fetch
Nel to Symonds, 1 run carved through the off side, Nel stares and Symonds just trots past him without even giving him the time of day
Nel to Clarke, FOUR runs slashed over gully this time
Nel to Clarke, no run better ball, on target and blocked
Nel to Clarke, no run outside off stump, Clarke leaves it
Nel to Clarke, 1 run outside off at 86mph, Clarke hits it into the ground, it dribbles into the off and they run a single
Hall to Clarke, 1 run pushed back straight as an arrow, mid-on again has to make a fair amount of ground to his left to field
Hall to Symonds, no run Symonds half forward and drives hard to extra cover
Hall to Symonds, no run whipped off middle to midwicket
Hall to Symonds, no run dropped full and creamed back at Hall's midriff, technically a chance but it was really travelling and at this stage of the game, there's not much point in heroics
Hall to Symonds, no run Symonds much more circumspect after the let-off
Nel to Clarke, no run driven into the ground and Nel takes at chest height in his follow through
Nel to Clarke, no run chipped to mid-on, in the air but Nel would have needed to be Spiderman to have got across to that
Nel to Clarke, no run wide and smeared to point where Gibbs makes a good stop diving to his right
Nel to Clarke, no run into the ground, Clarke ponders the single but the ball went no more a yard in front of him and Nel was wise to what he was thinking
Nel to Clarke, FOUR runs hit on the up, over mid-on and that's his fifty off 75 balls
Nel to Clarke, no run checked drive, with a sniff of an inside edge, to mid-on
Hall to Symonds, no run straight and Symonds very respectfully blocks
Hall to Symonds, no run swished off middle to midwicket where Kallis makes a decent stop even though he overshot once he had got a hand to the ball
Hall to Symonds, 2 runs clipped off leg stump to deep backward square leg
Hall to Symonds, 1 run Symonds heaves towards midwicket, get a thick edge and the ball scoots down to third man
Hall to Clarke, no run pushed to extra cover
Hall to Clarke, 1 run Clarke takes a couple of steps and drives to mid-on
Langeveldt to Clarke, 2 runs controlled cut to third man
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run patted into the covers
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run yorker, Clarke digs it out with a little sniff of lateness
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run outside off, no contact
Langeveldt to Clarke, no run blocked to extra cover
Hall to Symonds, 1 run worked through square leg
Hall to Clarke, FOUR runs Clarke gives himself room and cracks that back from where it came, with interest
Hall to Clarke, (no ball) 1 run driven past extra cover, and a no-ball
Hall to Symonds, FOUR runs leg-side full toss, Symonds does the business with a swish through midwicket and that's Australia into their fourth successive final

A clinical performance from the defending champions and the dominated this game from the off. The last few hours have been pretty poor for neutrals, dreadful for South Africans, but that's not Australia's fault. They have done the business and will meet Sri Lanka on Saturday in a re-match of the 1996 final.
Australia win by seven wickets The South Africans acknowledge the support they have received and then head off to lick their wounds, the Australians amble onto the outfield and start a lap of honour.

That's all from Jenny Thompson, Will Luke and Martin Williamson. Many thanks for staying with us through a one-sided match and we will be back, along with Sriram Veera and Jamie Alter, for Saturday's final. It's almost all over ...
Australia won by 7 wickets (with 111 balls remaining)
Player of the match is Glenn McGrath, AUS
